H0.text: Through filtration, a clothing manufacturer separates the colors in cotton fabric to determine the purity of the dyes added to the cellulose fibers.

H1.text: By their boiling points, clothing manufacturers separate the dyed colors of cotton fabrics to determine the purity of the dyes.

H2.text: By their freezing points, a clothing manufacturer can separate the colors of dyes added to cellulose fibers in cotton fabrics in order to determine the purity of those dyes.

H3.text: Paper chromatography is the method a clothing manufacturer uses to separate colors in dyed cotton fabric to determine the purity of the dyes.

A4.text: Paper chromatography is one method for testing the purity of compounds and identifying substances.
